content.description: An elephant pushes two heavy boxes, Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, to the right across a rough horizontal surface, as shown in the figure. Consider two situations:
content.question: 1. The boxes are moving with a constant velocity toward the right. 2. The boxes are accelerating toward the right. In each situation, compare the magnitude of the force <math alttext="F sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> that Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts on Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> with the magnitude of the force <math alttext="F sub B A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>BA</mi></msub></math> that Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> exerts on Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.Moving with constant velocityAcceleratingA<math alttext="F sub A B equals F sub B A" skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
